result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven W. Bruns III was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Steven W. Bruns III

records.addlTxt: Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

(Cases 21CM878, 22CM306, 22CF453 are called at 11:30 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Steven W. Bruns III appeared by phone, in custody from Dodge Correctional.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Steven W. Bruns III.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense indicates there is an agreement- recites the joint sentence recommendation. Defendant waives right to personal appearance. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads No Contest to 22CF453 Count 1- Battery to a Law Enforcement Officer as Repeater and Count 2- Resisting an Officer Causing Substantial Bodily Harm as Repeater & 22CM306 Count 1- Disorderly Conduct as Domestic. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in, including all of 21CM878. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Discussion held regarding restitution. Defendant makes a statement. 
Court withholds sentence in 22CF453 and orders 10 years Probation (which may end after 6 years, if Restitution is paid in full) with the following conditions: 120 days jail on Count 1 with Huber, all stayed pending further order of the court; No contact with T.S. or any Kwik Trip locations; Restitution in the amounts of $6,598.93 plus 10% surcharge from 22CF453 and $14.12 plus 10% surcharge from 22CM306 to be reimbursed at a rate no lower than $25 per month; Mental Health Assessment and any follow through; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. Court orders 136 days credit, if revoked in 22CF453. 
Court orders in 22CM306- Defendant to provide DNA sample, pay the surcharge, court costs.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights (with Attachments)
Status conference on October 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:46am Cases called: 21CM878, 22CF453 & 22CM306. Defendant Steven W. Bruns III not in court; in custody and the facility did not connect.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Steven W. Bruns III.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Status Conference: 10/25/22 at 11am

Cases called at 9:52 AM: 21CM878, 22CF453, 22CM306.
Defendant Steven W. Bruns III in court with Attorney Katherine Cook.  Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Cook requests an adjourned STC.
STC: 10/3/22 at 11:14 AM (Branch 4)
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 11:14 am.

9:03 AM cases 21CM878, 22CM306, 22CF453 called. Prosecuting attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven W. Bruns III in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Steven W. Bruns III. In 22CF453: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court.
Status conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on July 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

(Cases 21CM878, 22CF453, 22CM306 are called at 9:04 AM) Defendant Steven W. Bruns III in court, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Steven W. Bruns III. Deputy District Attorney Angela Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense raises competency concerns for the Defendant. Court has discussion with Defendant regarding his rights. 
Court orders Defendant to see doctor. Defense indicates the Defendant is on a Probation Hold. Court indicates he will order the jail to allow him to see his doctor. 
Defense filed a motion to modify bond. Court orders the bond is modified in 22CF453 to allow contact with his children by letter or phone. 
Arraignment in 22CF453 and Status Conference in 21CM878 & 22CM306: 7/28/2022 at 9:00 AM.
Status conference on June 27, 2022 at 09:00 am.

(2:14 PM cases 21CM878, 22CM306, 22CF453 called.) Prosecuting attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Steven W. Bruns III in court, in custody. Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Steven W. Bruns III.
Parties advise are ready to proceed. 
State calls Officer Timothy Aldrich of the Eau Claire Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Cook conducts cross-examination of Officer Aldrich. Witness excused.
State requests bind over. Attorney Cook reserves argument.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
Attorney Cook to schedule an Arraignment with the Branch 4 Judicial Assistant and cases 21CM878, 22CM306 will ride along.

Warrant executed.  Defense waives reading of the Complaint.
